content.body: `[Exposed]` works on methods, but only to constrain. So the solution would be to move `setTimeout` to an `AllTheGlobals` mixin that has `[Exposed=*]` and is included by `Window`, `WorkerGlobalScope`, etc.

content.body: Is there a term that means symbols + objects (+ functions, although thats implied by objects). Like there's primitives vs. objects, I'm wondering if theres a concise way to say "symbols and objects"
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Is there a term that means symbols + objects (+ functions, although thats implied by objects). Like there's primitives vs. objects, I'm wondering if theres a concise way to say "symbols and objects"

content.body: In the R&T proposal we say "unforgeable values": you cannot recreate them
However, it does not include Symbol.for symbols
content.formatted_body: However, it does not include Symbol.for symbols

content.body: * In the R&T proposal we say "unforgeable values": you cannot recreate them unless you already hold a reference to them

m.new_content.body: In the R&T proposal we say "unforgeable values": you cannot recreate them unless you already hold a reference to them

content.body: though that also covers spec-internal values, but outside the context of the spec that's probably fine
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: though that also covers spec-internal values, but outside the context of the spec that's probably fine

content.body: ftr i'm not a fan of using "identity" in that way, but that's what the editors chose. i'd just say "symbols and objects" personally (outside the spec)
